abstracts.cdata!:
The Mali Urban Development and
            Decentralization Project had an unsatisfactory outcome,
            unlikely sustainability, modest institutional development
            impact, overall satisfactory Bank performance, and overall
            unsatisfactory Borrower performance. Lessons cited from this
            project include: 1) Delegating management contracts to
            qualified and experienced agencies remains one of the best
            options to deliver infrastructure services quickly and
            effectively. 2) Municipal contracts are useful tools to
            improve performance of local governments but need to be
            monitored to be meaningful. 3) Using private sector
            approaches can provide improvement in urban land management
            and streamline urban land titling. 4) Cultural heritage
            operations are complex by themselves and adding them as a
            component of a project increases complexity. 5) Achieving
            infrastructure outputs may not lead to sustainable outcomes
            when capacity building is compromised.  6) Urban operations
            are complex by themselves and require long periods of
            implementation that exceed the five year period that has
            been the norm.
